```{r}
library(dplyr)
aggregated_data <- merged_data %>%
  group_by(TEAM, YEAR) %>%
  summarize_all(mean)
yearly_success <-subset(aggregated_data, select = -c(W, POSTSEASON, SEED, UNITID, STREET, CITY, STATE, ZIP, STFIP, NMCNTY, LOCALE, LAT, LON, CBSA, NMCBSA, CBSATYPE, CSA, NMCSA, NMNECTA, CD, SLDL, SLDU, SCHOOLYEAR, CNTY, NECTA))# You can use other aggregation functions like sum, median, etc.

# The result will have one row for each unique combination of TEAM and YEAR,
# with aggregated values for all numeric columns
# You can save this aggregated data to a new CSV file if needed
write.csv(yearly_success, "yearly_success.csv", row.names = FALSE)

```
```{r}
dput(aggregated_data)aggregated_data <- read.csv("aggregated_data.csv")
```
